resources.string: Escape from the Aliens in Outer Space
Escape from the Aliens in Outer Space
This is where a logo will go
This app is to be used in conjunction with the Escape from the Aliens in Outer Space board game.
• Select the number of players using the dropdown\n • Change the names of players by selecting a text box and changing the name.\n

• The number in the lower right corner of the screen represents the current round in the game.
 • Turn navigation is in the upper right corner
 • The player with the yellow outline is the player whose turn it is.
 • Touch a sector to add a move indicator to it for the current player and turn.
 • Touching the hexagon again will turn the move indicator into a square. You can use square to indicate moves of which you are certain.
 • Touch the sector a third time to remove the move from that turn and player.
 • Touch the right arrow to increment the player turn. When the last player has gone, touching the right arrow will increment the round. This option automatically skips dead players.
 • Touch the pencil (edit) icon to display the Edit Turn panel.
 • The number that displays in blue represents the current turn that you are editing.
 • Touch the right arrow to increment the turn that you are editing. If you are editing the current game turn, touching the right arrow will start a new turn.
 • Touch the left arrow to edit a previous turn.
 • Touch the current turn number to return to editing the current turn.
 • The player with the yellow outline is the one whose turn you are editing.
 • Touch a different player box to change the currently selected player.
 • Touch the pencil again to remove the Edit Turn panel and return to moving through player turns.
 • Touch and hold any player's colored square to add an indicator for human vs. alien vs. dead. This will add a red halo around the player box for humans, and a green halo for aliens.
 • If you choose 'dead' (X), that player's player box will be grayed out, and his/her turn will be skipped. You will not be able to add moves for that player, although you can touch and hold his/her square to change the player status back to human, alien, or uncertain.
 • Pinch to zoom and drag to scroll.

• Touch blank sectors once to add a safe sector, and twice to add an unsafe sector.\n • Touch and hold a special sector (alien start, human start, escape hatch) to allow dragging and dropping.\n • Touch the check icon to enter a name and save the map to the My Maps section.
